intro: Bracteola subaequigluma, commonly known as the narrow-bracted grass, is a species of grass found in tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features include narrow, parallel-veined leaves and a compact growth habit. It plays a minor ecological role in its native environments, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
